title.rendered: DO I NEED A MAC TO DEVELOP IOS APPLICATIONS?

content.rendered:
Do I essentially need to make use of a Mac to make superior iOS applications?  These could involve applications for iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch etc. The very simple answer to this is no. But there are other factors we need to assess before applying this statement.

When in the process of application development for any iOS enabled gadgets like iPhone, MacBook, iPad and Apple Watch you have to utilize Xcode. Xcode is a free programming software made by Apple that enables you to plan and code up applications. Xcode just deals with Apple’s working framework, OS X. So on the off chance that you have a Mac; at that point, you can run Xcode no issue. If you don’t have a Mac, there are two works around that I am aware that you can utilize. So altogether there are three ways you can run Xcode. Keep reading if you want to know more.

  1. Utilizing a Mac

This, without doubt, is the best alternative. Making use of Apple’s equipment to run Xcode will be the best understanding of mobile application development. Not everyone has the access to a Mac and getting one can turn out to be expensive. Though for developers this trouble is justified. This is the easiest and most lucrative of the methods.

  1. Utilizing a Cloud Service

It’s an extremely inventive answer for helping those who don’t have a Mac make stellar applications. There are few organizations that possess a bundle of Mac PCs and enable you to get to them by means of the web and control them remotely. It’s sort of like leasing a Mac month to month. All you require is a web program to get to your machine. The drawback to this is you need to pay a month to month expense and you should be associated with the web to do your work. Some organizations that do this are machincloud.com and xcodeclud.com.

  1. Virtual Machine

This choice includes making a virtual machine on your PC, introducing Apple’s OS X working framework, and after that running Xcode on that virtual machine. This is the least preferred alternative for the following reasons:

It’s confounded. It takes a great deal of work and specialized know how to get your virtual machine set up.

It’s illicit. Apple doesn’t offer OS X without anyone else’s input as a remain solitary item. They offer PCs with OS X on them. Consequently, you can’t purchase a duplicate of OS X and run it on your PC. You would need to download it illicitly. A few people contend that Apple could never come after you for doing this yet I don’t believe it’s justified regardless of the hazard what’s more; you will have a much better involvement with a real Mac.

All in all, if you have the budget for a Mac – shoot! If you don’t here are your options. A wise decision right now can help aid your iOS application development tremendously.
